values.user_data:
#!/bin/bash
set -euo pipefail

# Basic hardening
dnf -y update

# Install Docker
dnf -y install docker
systemctl enable docker
systemctl start docker

# Allow ec2-user to run docker without sudo (optional)
usermod -aG docker ec2-user || true

# Install SSM agent (AL2023 usually has it, but ensure)
dnf -y install amazon-ssm-agent || true
systemctl enable amazon-ssm-agent
systemctl restart amazon-ssm-agent || true



# Run container (GitLab CI can still redeploy by pulling a new tag and restarting)
# Stop/remove existing container if present
if docker ps -a --format '{{.Names}}' | grep -q '^portfolio-nginx$'; then
  docker rm -f portfolio-nginx || true
fi

# Pull and run
# NOTE: If your registry requires auth, GitLab CI deploy step should run `docker login` first.
docker pull registry.gitlab.com/dmitry1094608/dmitryportfolio/portfolioimage:main || true

docker run -d \
  --name portfolio-nginx \
  --restart unless-stopped \
  -p 80:80 \
  -p 443:443 \
  registry.gitlab.com/dmitry1094608/dmitryportfolio/portfolioimage:main

after.user_data:
#!/bin/bash
set -euo pipefail

# Basic hardening
dnf -y update

# Install Docker
dnf -y install docker
systemctl enable docker
systemctl start docker

# Allow ec2-user to run docker without sudo (optional)
usermod -aG docker ec2-user || true

# Install SSM agent (AL2023 usually has it, but ensure)
dnf -y install amazon-ssm-agent || true
systemctl enable amazon-ssm-agent
systemctl restart amazon-ssm-agent || true



# Run container (GitLab CI can still redeploy by pulling a new tag and restarting)
# Stop/remove existing container if present
if docker ps -a --format '{{.Names}}' | grep -q '^portfolio-nginx$'; then
  docker rm -f portfolio-nginx || true
fi

# Pull and run
# NOTE: If your registry requires auth, GitLab CI deploy step should run `docker login` first.
docker pull registry.gitlab.com/dmitry1094608/dmitryportfolio/portfolioimage:main || true

docker run -d \
  --name portfolio-nginx \
  --restart unless-stopped \
  -p 80:80 \
  -p 443:443 \
  registry.gitlab.com/dmitry1094608/dmitryportfolio/portfolioimage:main

values.description: Amazon Linux 2023 AMI 2023.8.20250915.0 x86_64 Minimal HVM kernel-6.1
values.name: al2023-ami-minimal-2023.8.20250915.0-kernel-6.1-x86_64

ec2_instance_id.description: EC2 instance ID for the Docker host.

ec2_public_ip.description: EC2 public IP (useful for SSH if enabled).

container_image.description: Container image to run on the EC2 host (e.g., registry.gitlab.com/<group>/<project>/<image>:tag).

domain_name.description: Fully qualified domain name to serve (e.g., projects.example.com). Required if enable_https=true or if you want Route53 record.

enable_cloudwatch_logs.description: If true, install and configure the CloudWatch Agent to ship /var/log/messages and docker logs (basic).

enable_https.description: If true, create an ACM certificate and HTTPS listener on the ALB. Requires a public Route53 hosted zone and a domain name.

hosted_zone_id.description: Route53 hosted zone ID for domain_name. Required if enable_https=true or if you want Route53 record.

instance_type.description: EC2 instance type for the Docker host.

project_name.description: Project/name prefix used for tagging and resource names.

ssh_allowed_cidrs.description: CIDR allowlist for inbound SSH (22). Keep this tight (e.g., your office/VPN or GitLab runner egress IPs).

ssh_public_key.description: Public key material to create an EC2 key pair (optional). If empty, no key pair is created and SSH access is disabled unless you attach a key manually.
